qas.question: What was the group that used incendiaries and high explosives to mark targets?
The Feuerleitung (Blaze Control) tactic led to what creation for marking targets?
What was the nickname of bombs used in streets and residential areas?
What was the weight of the "Max" bomb?

context: Special units, such as KGr 100, became the <a0_0>Beleuchtergruppe<a0_0/> (Firelighter Group), which used incendiaries and high explosive to mark the target area. The tactic was expanded into Feuerleitung (Blaze Control) with the creation of <a1_0>Brandbombenfelder (Incendiary Fields)<a1_0/> to mark targets. These were marked out by parachute flares. Then bombers carrying SC 1000 (1,000 kg (2,205 lb)), SC 1400 (1,400 kg (3,086 lb)), and SC 1800 (1,800 kg (3,968 lb)) <a2_0>"Satan"<a2_0/> bombs were used to level streets and residential areas. By December, the SC 2500 (<a3_0>2,500 kg (5,512 lb)<a3_0/>) "Max" bomb was used.
